div.l: Lo Depword and it is half wey prime
Lo Grenewich there many a shrewe is in
It were high tyme thi tale to beginne
Now sirs quod this Oswolde the Reue
I pray you alle that ye nat you greue
Thouȝ I ansuere and somdel set his howe
For liefull is with force force of showe
This dronken Millere hath told vs here
Hou that beguiled was a Carpentere
Parauenture in scorn̄ for ik am oon̄
And be your leue I shal him quite anon̄
Riȝt in his cherles termes wol I speke
I pray to god his necke mut to be breke
He can wel in myn yhe see a stalk
But in his ougne he can nat se a balk

l.hi: Hiere beginneth the Reues tale folwing

div.l:
At Trompington nat
fer from Cambrigge
There goth a brook ⁊and ouer that a brigge
Vpon the wich brook ther stant a mille
And this is verri soth that I you telle
A Millere was there duelling many a day
As any Pecok he was proude ⁊and gay
Pipe he couthe fisshe ⁊and nettes bete
And torne cuppes and wel wrastle and shete
Ay be his belte he bar a long panade
And a fyn swerd full trenchant was the blade
A ioly popper bar he in his pouche
There was noman for perill durst him touche
A sheffeld thwitell bar he in his hose
Round was his face and camuse was his nose
As piled as an ape was his sculle
He was a market beter at the fulle
There durst no wiȝt honde on him legge
That he ne swore he shuld anon abegge
A thef he was forsothe bothe of corn̄ ⁊and mele
